Applies to

  • PHP

What to Do

Enable SSL/TLS for all the sensitive pages on the web application server.

Why

SSL/TLS should be used to protect all pages that handle sensitive data to protect from Man-in-the-Middle attacks.

How

The exact instructions for enabling SSL/TLS are different for different servers. Enabling SSL/TLS is a common task and is well documented for common web server platforms. Links at the bottom of this page lead to documentation that explains how to enable SSL/TLS on different platforms. There are some general guidelines that apply to different platforms:

  1. Get valid certificates. Purchase a valid SSL/TLS certificate. You may purchase a valid SSL/TLS key from VeriSign, Thawte, or your web hosting provider. Follow the vendor's instructions for purchasing the SSL/TLS certificate. The certificate is usually a .cer file.

  2. Identify sensitive pages. Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive information, including all pages that use authentication or authorization features.

  3. Enable SSL/TLS on the web server. The exact instructions for enabling SSL/TLS are different for different web servers. Please, see the links at the bottom of this page for more information about enabling SSL/TLS on some common web application platforms.

  4. Use SSL/TLS to protect the sensitive pages. The exact instructions for doing so are different for different web servers. Use the web server administration interface or edit the server configuration files to enable SSL/TLS for all folders containing sensitive pages.

  5. Redirect non-HTTPS requests to SSL/TLS protected pages. The exact instructions for doing so are different for different web servers. Use the web server administration interface or edit the server configuration files to redirect non-HTTPS requests to SSL/TLS protected pages.

Additional Resources

  • For information about configuring SSL/TLS in Apache, please see http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/ssl/ssl_howto.html
  • For more information about using SSL/TLS with Apache, please see http://www.nurdletech.com/https.html

Transport Layer Protection Guidelines

  • Use SSL
  • Use SSL for All Sensitive Pages
  • Use Only Strong SSL Algorithms
  • Use Valid SSL Certificates

Transport Layer Protection Checklists

  • SSL Is Enabled
  • SSL Is Used for All Sensitive Pages
  • Only Strong SSL Algorithms Are Used
  • Valid SSL Certificates Are Used
